title: How to Make Holiday Fruit Drop Cookies

steps.headline: Place the brown sugar, shortening, buttermilk and eggs into a mixing bowl.
Mix the ingredients with a handheld mixer or with a stand mixer using a paddle attachment.
steps.description: Set your mixer at medium speed.

steps.headline: Mix the flour, baking soda and kosher salt in another mixing bowl, whisking the ingredients so that they are well combined.
Add 1/3 of the flour mixture to the wet ingredients, continuing to beat the dough at medium speed.
When the first 1/3 of the flour mixture is incorporated, add another 1/3.
Add the remaining 1/3 of the flour mixture into the wet ingredients and mix until it’s just combined.
Using a large plastic spoon, fold in the candied cherries, dates and chopped toasted pecans.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate the dough for 1 hour.
Heat the oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Remove the dough from the refrigerator and discard the plastic wrap.
Scoop one ball of dough with a cookie scoop or with a teaspoon, rolling it into a ball with your clean hands.
Place the dough ball onto the cookie sheet, making sure that it is about 2" from the edges.
Form another ball of dough and place it about 2" away from the first ball of dough.
Repeat this process until your cookie sheet is full of cookies, doing your best to make each dough ball as uniform as possible.
Press a pecan half into the top of each cookie.
Bake the cookies for 4 minutes and turn the pan 90 degrees.
Remove the cookie sheet from the oven and immediately remove the cookies with a spatula to a wire rack to cool.

text: Prepare the Dough Place the brown sugar, shortening, buttermilk and eggs into a mixing bowl.  Mix the ingredients with a handheld mixer or with a stand mixer using a paddle attachment. Set your mixer at medium speed. Mix the flour, baking soda and kosher salt in another mixing bowl, whisking the ingredients so that they are well combined.  Add 1/3 of the flour mixture to the wet ingredients, continuing to beat the dough at medium speed.  When the first 1/3 of the flour mixture is incorporated, add another 1/3.  Add the remaining 1/3 of the flour mixture into the wet ingredients and mix until it’s just combined.  Using a large plastic spoon, fold in the candied cherries, dates and chopped toasted pecans.  Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate the dough for 1 hour.  Bake the Cookies Heat the oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.  Remove the dough from the refrigerator and discard the plastic wrap.  Scoop one ball of dough with a cookie scoop or with a teaspoon, rolling it into a ball with your clean hands.  Place the dough ball onto the cookie sheet, making sure that it is about 2" from the edges.  Form another ball of dough and place it about 2" away from the first ball of dough.  Repeat this process until your cookie sheet is full of cookies, doing your best to make each dough ball as uniform as possible.  Press a pecan half into the top of each cookie.  Bake the cookies for 4 minutes and turn the pan 90 degrees. Bake an additional 4 to 6 minutes. Remove the cookie sheet from the oven and immediately remove the cookies with a spatula to a wire rack to cool.
